p: According to the literature, this is a first-time evaluation of changes in the TAC during the year. The TAC of the plant obtained in winter was significantly higher than in other seasons ( Figure 3). A significant increase in the concentration of anthocyanins in the winter seems to be probably a defense mechanism against low temperature stress to reduce the damage of cell and tissue freezing [ 28, 29, 30, 31, 32, 33]. The results interestingly revealed the variations pattern of anthocyanins was opposite with flavones and flavanols. Because the dihydro-flavonol is a common intermediate precursor of anthocyanins, flavones and flavanols [ 34], it seems that the decrease in temperature during winter has led to a change in the biosynthesis of flavones towards the production of anthocyanins, thereby reducing flavones and increasing anthocyanins.
